page.title: 07KINLOCH CASTLE,RHUM_TOURS
page.content: During the summer a tour is offered. The interior & furnishings are much as they were when it was built.The Main Hall,corridors & some downstair rooms are oak panelled. The Hall has a gallery round 2 sides at 1st floor level. Several pieces of furniture & many ornaments came from the Far East, being brought back by Sir George on his return from a world cruise in his steam yacht "Rhouma".The Billiard Room & Smoke Room have examples of early double_glazing & air_conditioning. The Ladies' Drawing Room,a Library & a Ballroom (with Minstrel's Gallery) also feature. Under the main stair is an Orchestrion which plays perforated rolls of music. Upstairs, some bed_ rooms have 4_poster beds & most have dressing_rooms & bathrooms _ the baths a forerunner of the shower with 6 taps sending out water in all directions!
